snippet: The move by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel comes after days of intense political bickering with centrists in his coalition.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu, signaling the start of his re-election campaign, fires Justice Min Yair Lapid and Finance Min Tzipi Livni, both centrists, and requests dissolution of Parliament and early elections; says he will not tolerate any more criticisms in 20-month-old coalition government; both Livni and Lapid have denounced Netanyahu's settlement construction plans.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: The move by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel comes after days of intense political bickering with centrists in his coalition.

headline.main: Netanyahu Fires Ministers and Calls for Elections
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu Fires Ministers and Calls for Elections
